examples: a 54-year-old woman
an interesting young woman
married/single women
men, women and children
a women's group/movement
I prefer to see a woman doctor.
women in business
Older women often feel invisible.
She is a role model for other women.
The freedom to wear trousers became a symbol of women's liberation.
She plays for the women's team.
The little girl she remembered was now a grown woman.
There were important changes in the position of women in society.
We want to change the way women are depicted in the media.
Women were limited to the more poorly paid jobs.
Why should women be reduced to playing a passive role?
a United Nations report on violence against women
a professor of women's studies
Both men and women should have access to paid parental leave.
The drug carries a warning against use by pregnant women.
There are many professional opportunities for young women today.
Two well-dressed women were sitting at the next table.
Our mother was a very beautiful woman.
She worked for women's rights.
(informal) She's all woman! (= has qualities that are typical of women)

meanings.def: a woman who comes from the place mentioned or whose job or interest is connected with the thing mentioned
examples: an Englishwoman
a businesswoman
a Congresswoman
a horsewoman

meanings.def: a female worker, especially one who works with her hands
examples: We used to have a woman to do the cleaning.

meanings.def: a rude way of addressing a female person, especially when telling her what to do
examples: Be quiet, woman!

meanings.def: a person's wife, girlfriend or female partner
examples: He's got a new woman in his life.

meanings.def: to act or think independently, not following others or being ordered
examples: Working for herself meant that she could be her own woman.

meanings.def: used to refer to somebody, usually a woman, who has reacted very angrily to something, especially the fact that her husband or partner has been unfaithful
with a lot of force or energy
examples: She flew out of the room like a woman possessed.

meanings.def: to marry a woman after having had a sexual relationship with her, especially if she is pregnant
a man/woman who likes the same things or has the same opinions as you
an average or ordinary person, either male or female
examples: Politicians often don't understand the views of the man in the street.
What really matters to the man and woman in the street?

meanings.def: a man/woman who understands and supports ordinary people
examples: She wanted to seem like a woman of the people.

meanings.def: a rich and powerful man or woman
a person with a lot of experience of life, who is not easily surprised or shocked

idioms.def: to act or think independently, not following others or being ordered
examples: Working for herself meant that she could be her own woman.

idioms.idiom: hell hath no fury (like a woman scorned)
idioms.def: used to refer to somebody, usually a woman, who has reacted very angrily to something, especially the fact that her husband or partner has been unfaithful

idioms.idiom: like a man/woman possessed | like one possessed
idioms.def: with a lot of force or energy
examples: She flew out of the room like a woman possessed.

idioms.idiom: make an honest woman of somebody
idioms.def: to marry a woman after having had a sexual relationship with her, especially if she is pregnant

idioms.idiom: a man/woman after your own heart
idioms.def: a man/woman who likes the same things or has the same opinions as you

idioms.idiom: the man (and/or woman) in the street
idioms.def: an average or ordinary person, either male or female
examples: Politicians often don't understand the views of the man in the street.
What really matters to the man and woman in the street?

idioms.def: a man/woman who understands and supports ordinary people
examples: She wanted to seem like a woman of the people.

idioms.def: a rich and powerful man or woman
a person with a lot of experience of life, who is not easily surprised or shocked

related: Old Woman Who Lived in a Shoe
old woman who lived in a shoe
